summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 7263, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Valley Street, in the City of Seattle, from Queen Anne Avenue to Lake Union, by grading, sidewalking and parking the same as follows: from Queen Ann Avenue to Second Avenue North to have a divided roadway separated by a terrace and parking strips between sidewalks and the property lines; from Second Avenue North to Lake Union, to be graded, sidewalked and parked, according to plans of the City Engineer; and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said City, approved December 6, 1899.
